concept.title: High-availability deployments
concept.shortdesc: Additional considerations and requirements for a high-availability configuration are described in this chapter.

conbody.p: can be deployed in a high-availability (HA) configuration to minimize downtime caused by the failure of hardware components or operating system services in a master host.

A high-availability deployment can be configured in a variety of ways, including the following:
Active-Active, non geo-diverse
Active-Passive, geo-diverse
Active-Passive, non geo-diverse (described in this chapter)

The configuration described in this chapter has the following characteristics and requirements:
uses Pacemaker, Corosync, and Distributed Replicated Block Device (DRBD)
lacks geo-diversity and provides no protection against a facility catastrophe because the primary and secondary nodes are located in the same facility
has two or more identical master hosts - One is the primary node in the high-availability cluster, and the other is the secondary node that takes over as master host if the primary node becomes unavailable.
has two delegate hosts
